meanings.definition: To record or enter in a register.
meanings.sent1: I am enregistering the new students in our school database.
meanings.sent2: The librarian is enregistering the borrowed books in the system.
meanings.sent3: The computer kept enregistering the same information over and over.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was enregistering every detail of the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The camera was enregistering the joyful expressions of the children playing.

meanings.sent1: The secretary is enregistering the names of the attendees for the event.
meanings.sent2: The government office is enregistering the new laws passed by the parliament.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be enregistering the birds outside for future reference.
meanings.sent4: The historian's memory enregisters every significant event in history.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush enregisters the vibrant colors of the landscape.

meanings.sent1: Parents are enregistering their children for the upcoming school year.
meanings.sent2: The university is enregistering new students for the fall semester.
meanings.sent3: The robot mistakenly started enregistering random objects in its memory.
meanings.sent4: The heart enregisters the emotions that words fail to express.
meanings.sent5: The pen enregisters the writer's thoughts on the blank page.
